ConfigItem.Name: SecureMode
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, the web installer (http://yourhost.example.com/otrs/installer.pl) can't be used. This setting should be set to "Yes" to prevent your system from being hijacked. If set to "No", you can reinstall your system. Your current basic configuration will be used to pre-populate the questions within the installer script. Also disables if not active, the GenericAgent, PackageManager and SQL Box, since it's possible to use it for destructive write queries such as DROP DATABASE, and also to steal user passwords.

ConfigItem.Name: ProductName
ConfigItem.Description: This setting controls the name of the application as is shown in the web interface as well as the tabs and title bar of your web browser.

ConfigItem.Name: SystemID
ConfigItem.Description: The system identifier. Every ticket number contains this ID, and the session ID, of a http session string, starts with this number. This ensures that only tickets which belong to your system will be processed as follow-ups. This could be use full when communicating between two instances of OTRS. So be sure of what you choose when you set this setting.

ConfigItem.Name: FQDN
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the fully qualified domain name of your system here. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

ConfigItem.Name: HttpType
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the type of protocol, used by your web server, to serve the application. If you want to use the https protocol, instead of plain http, please specify it here. This has no affect on your web server's settings or behavior. This setting will not change the method of access to the application. If this setting is wrong, it will not prevent you from logging into the application. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

ConfigItem.Name: ScriptAlias
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the prefix to the scripts folder on your server as configured on your web server. This setting is used as a variable, OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system.

ConfigItem.Name: AdminEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the system administrator's e-mail address. This is the e-mail address that will be displayed in error screens of the application.

ConfigItem.Name: Organization
ConfigItem.Description: If configured, all e-mails sent by the application will contain a X-Header with this organization or company name.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultCharset
ConfigItem.Description: Please configure the default charset for the web interface to use. The charset "utf-8" is a good choice for environments expecting many charsets. You can specify another charset here (i.e. "iso-8859-1"). Please be sure that you will not be receiving foreign e-mails, or text, otherwise this could lead to problems. This setting should represent that of the charset used to create the database or, in some cases, that of the database management system being used.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultLanguage
ConfigItem.Description: The default front-end language. Possible values that can be used are determined by the available language files on your system. Please see the next setting to determine which values can be used.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultUsedLanguages
ConfigItem.Description: These are all of the languages that are available to the application. The Key/Content pair links the front-end display name to the appropriate language PM file. The "Key" value should be the base-name of your PM file (i.e. de.pm is the file, then de is the "Key" value). The "Content" value should be the display name for the front-end. If you create your own language (see the developer documentation http://doc.otrs.org/ for more infomation), then you can add it here. Please remember, if you language uses non-ASCII characters, you must use the HTML equivalent for the proper display to occur (i.e. for the German oe = o umlaut, it is necessary to use the ö symbol).

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultTheme
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the default front-end (HTML) theme to be used by your agents and customers. The default themes are Standard and Lite. If you like, you can add your own theme. Please refer the the administrator manual located at http://doc.otrs.org/.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultTheme::HostBased
ConfigItem.Description: It is possible to configure different themes, for example to distinguish between agents and customers, to be used on a per-domain basis within the application. Using a regular expression (regex), you can configure a Key/Content pair to match a domain. The value in "Key" should match the domain, and the value in "Content" should be a valid theme on your system. Please see the example entries for the proper form of the regex.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::WebPath
ConfigItem.Description: URL base path of icons, CSS and Java Script.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::ImagePath
ConfigItem.Description: URL image path of icons for navigation.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CSSPath
ConfigItem.Description: URL CSS path.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::JavaScriptPath
ConfigItem.Description: URL JavaScript path.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichText
ConfigItem.Description: Use richtext for viewing and editor for article, salutation, signature, standard_response, auto_response, notification.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichTextPath
ConfigItem.Description: URL RichTextEditor path.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichTextWidth
ConfigItem.Description: Width for RichText editor component. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichTextHeight
ConfigItem.Description: Height for RichText editor component. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::RichText::DefaultCSS
ConfigItem.Description: Use richtext editor default CSS.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultViewNewLine
ConfigItem.Description: Automated line break in text messages after x number of chars.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultPreViewLines
ConfigItem.Description: Count of lines that are displayed in the preview of messages (e.g. for tickets in the QueueView).

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultViewLines
ConfigItem.Description: Amount of lines that are displayed in text messages (e.g. ticket lines in the QueueZoom).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeInputFormat
ConfigItem.Description: Used date input format in forms (option or input fields).

ConfigItem.Name: TimeCalendarLookup
ConfigItem.Description: Enable a calender lookup window on date selections.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeShowAlwaysLong
ConfigItem.Description: Show time in long (days, hours, minutes) or short (days, hours) format.

ConfigItem.Name: AttachmentDownloadType
ConfigItem.Description: Show the attachments of a ticket in the browser (inline) or just make them downloadable (attachment).

ConfigItem.Name: CheckMXRecord
ConfigItem.Description: Should the application check the MX record of e-mail addresses before sending an e-mail or submitting a telephone or e-mail ticket?

ConfigItem.Name: CheckMXRecord::Nameserver
ConfigItem.Description: If it is necessary for the application to use a dedicated DNS server for the "CheckMXRecord" look-ups, please configure this settng here.

ConfigItem.Name: CheckEmailAddresses
ConfigItem.Description: Should the application check the syntax of e-mail addresses.

ConfigItem.Name: CheckEmailValidAddress
ConfigItem.Description: If "CheckEmailAddresses" is set to "yes", it may be necessary to exclude some addresses from this check. Please enter a regex in this field for e-mail addresses, that aren't syntactically valid, but are necessary for the system (i.e. "root@localhost").

ConfigItem.Name: CheckEmailInvalidAddress
ConfigItem.Description: The regex found in this setting can filter all e-mail addresses that should not be used in the application.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::ViewMode
ConfigItem.Description: Determines the way the linked objects are displayed in each zoom mask.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::Type###Normal
ConfigItem.Description: This setting defines the link type 'Normal'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one. If the values are different, the resulting link is a directional link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::Type###ParentChild
ConfigItem.Description: This setting defines the link type 'ParentChild'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one. If the values are different, the resulting link is a directional link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::TypeGroup###0001
ConfigItem.Description: This setting defines the link type groups. The link types of the same group cancel one another. Example: If ticket A is linked per a 'Normal' link with ticket B, then these tickets could not be additionally linked with link of a 'ParentChild' relationship.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule
ConfigItem.Description: Log module for the system. "File" writes all messages in a given logfile, "SysLog" uses the syslog daemon of the system, e.g. syslogd.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::SysLog::Facility
ConfigItem.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, you can specify a special log facility.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::SysLog::LogSock
ConfigItem.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, you can specify a special log sock (on solaris you may need to use 'stream').

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::SysLog::Charset
ConfigItem.Description: If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, you can specify the charset that should be used for logging.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::LogFile
ConfigItem.Description: If "file" was selected for LogModule, you have to specify a logfile. The file will be created by the system, if it doesn't exist.

ConfigItem.Name: LogModule::LogFile::Date
ConfigItem.Description: Set this config parameter to "Yes", if you want to add a suffix with the actual year and month to the otrs logfile. A logfile for every month will be created.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule
ConfigItem.Description: Module to send emails. "Sendmail" directly uses the sendmail binary of your operating system. "SMTP/SMTPS" uses a specified (external) mailserver. "DoNotSendEmail" is not sending emails and useful for test systems.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::CMD
ConfigItem.Description: If "Sendmail" was selected for SendmailModule you have to specify the location of your sendmail binary and the needed options.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::Host
ConfigItem.Description: If "SMTP/SMTPS" was selected for SendmailModule you have to specify the mailhost that sends out the mails.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::Port
ConfigItem.Description: If "SMTP/SMTPS" was selected for SendmailModule specify the port where your mailserver is listening for incoming connections.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::AuthUser
ConfigItem.Description: If "SMTP/SMTPS" was selected for SendmailModule and you need to authenticate to your mailserver, specify the username.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailModule::AuthPassword
ConfigItem.Description: If "SMTP/SMTPS" was selected for SendmailModule and you need to authenticate to your mailserver, specify the password.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailBcc
ConfigItem.Description: Send all outgoing email via bcc to the specified address. Please use this only for backup reasons.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom
ConfigItem.Description: If set, this address is used as envelope from header in outgoing notifications. If no address is specified, the envelope from header is empty.

ConfigItem.Name: SendmailEncodingForce
ConfigItem.Description: To force encoding of outboing emails (7bit|8bit|quoted-printable|base64).

ConfigItem.Name: LoginURL
ConfigItem.Description: Alternate URL, where the login link refers to.

ConfigItem.Name: LogoutURL
ConfigItem.Description: Alternate URL, where the logout link refers to.

ConfigItem.Name: PreApplicationModule###AgentInfo
ConfigItem.Description: This module is useful to load specific user options or to display news.

ConfigItem.Name: InfoKey
ConfigItem.Description: Key to check with Kernel::Modules::AgentInfo module. If this user preferences key is true the message is accepted by the system.

ConfigItem.Name: InfoFile
ConfigItem.Description: File that is displayed, if located under Kernel/Output/HTML/Standard/AgentInfo.dtl.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::HeaderMetaModule###1-Refresh
ConfigItem.Description: Module to generate html refresh header of html sites.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###1-CharsetCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to inform agents via the agent interface about the used charset. A notification is displayed, if the default charset is not used, e.g. in tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###2-UID-Check
ConfigItem.Description: Module to display a notification in the agent interface, if the system is used by the admin user (normally you shouldn't work as admin).

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###3-ShowAgentOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Module to show currently logged in agents in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NotifyModule###4-ShowCustomerOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Module to show currently loged in customers in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionModule
ConfigItem.Description: Module to store the session data. Advantage of "DB" is that you can split the frontend server from the db server. "FS" is faster.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionName
ConfigItem.Description: Name of the session key. E.g. Session, SessionID or OTRS.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionCheckRemoteIP
ConfigItem.Description: If the application is used for example via a proxy farm or a dialup connection, the remote ip address is mostly different for the requests. Turn of this check, if you are in this situation.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionDeleteIfNotRemoteID
ConfigItem.Description: Delete a session, if the session id is used with an invalid remote IP?

ConfigItem.Name: SessionMaxTime
ConfigItem.Description: Maximal valid time for a session id (in seconds).

ConfigItem.Name: SessionMaxIdleTime
ConfigItem.Description: A session will be killed and the user will be loged out after this time of inactivity (in seconds).

ConfigItem.Name: SessionDeleteIfTimeToOld
ConfigItem.Description: Delete requested sessions if they have timed out?

ConfigItem.Name: SessionUseCookie
ConfigItem.Description: Should the session management use html cookies? If html cookies are disabled or if the client browser disabled html cookies, then the system will work as usual and append the session id to the links.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionUseCookieAfterBrowserClose
ConfigItem.Description: Store cookies after the browser has been closed?

ConfigItem.Name: SessionCSRFProtection
ConfigItem.Description: Protection against CSRF (Cross Site Request Forgery) exploits (for more info see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery).

ConfigItem.Name: SessionDir
ConfigItem.Description: If "FS" was selected for SessionModule you have to specify a directory where the session data will be stored.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionTable
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for SessionModule, you have to specify a table in database where session data will be stored.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionTableID
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for SessionModule, you have to specify a column for ID in session table.

ConfigItem.Name: SessionTableValue
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for SessionModule, you have to specify a column for the values in session table.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone
ConfigItem.Description: Set the system time zone (required a system with UTC as system time). Otherwise this is a diff time to the local time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZoneUser
ConfigItem.Description: Set the user time zone per user (required a system with UTC as system time and UTC under TimeZone). Otherwise this is a diff time to the local time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZoneUserBrowserAutoOffset
ConfigItem.Description: Set the user time zone per user based on java script / browser time zone offset feature at login time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar1Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar1
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar2Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar2
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar3Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar3
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar4Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar4
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar5Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar5
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar6Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar6
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar7Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar7
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar8Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar8
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar9Name
ConfigItem.Description: Calendar Name.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeZone::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: The time zone of the queue.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDays::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Add your permanent vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeVacationDaysOneTime::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: One time vacation days. Use single-digit pattern for months January to September and for days of month lower than ten.

ConfigItem.Name: TimeWorkingHours::Calendar9
ConfigItem.Description: Hours and week days to count the working time.

ConfigItem.Name: WebMaxFileUpload
ConfigItem.Description: Maximal size for file uploads via the browser (in Bytes).

ConfigItem.Name: WebUploadCacheModule
ConfigItem.Description: Select the module to handle uploads via the web interface. "DB" stores all uploads in the database, "FS" uses the file system.

ConfigItem.Name: CGILogPrefix
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the text that should appear in the log file to denote a CGI script entry.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::FilterText###AAAURL
ConfigItem.Description: A filter to process the text in the articles in order to highlight URLs.

ConfigItem.Name: LanguageSelectionLogin
ConfigItem.Description: Activate select language option on login page?

ConfigItem.Name: LostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Activate lost password feature for agents?

ConfigItem.Name: ShowMotd
ConfigItem.Description: Show message of the day on login screen?

ConfigItem.Name: DemoSystem
ConfigItem.Description: Should the system be run in "Demo" mode? If set to "Yes", agents can change preferences such as selection of language and theme via the agent web interface. These changes are only valid for the current session. It will not be possible for agents to change their passwords.

ConfigItem.Name: SwitchToUser
ConfigItem.Description: Should the administrators be allowed, via the users administration panel, to login as other users?

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/excel
ConfigItem.Description: Path to converter to view Microsoft Excel files in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/msword
ConfigItem.Description: Path to converter to view Microsoft Word files in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###application/pdf
ConfigItem.Description: Path to programm to view PDF Documents in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: MIME-Viewer###text/xml
ConfigItem.Description: Path to converter to view XML files in the web interface.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellChecker
ConfigItem.Description: Enable or disable spell checker support.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellCheckerBin
ConfigItem.Description: Install ispell or aspell on your system, if you want to use a spellchecker. Please specify the path to the aspell or ispell binary on your operating system.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellCheckerDictDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Default spell checker dictionary.

ConfigItem.Name: SpellCheckerIgnore
ConfigItem.Description: A list of words, that are ignored by the spell checker by default.

ConfigItem.Name: WebUserAgent::Timeout
ConfigItem.Description: Timeout for http/ftp downloads (in seconds).

ConfigItem.Name: WebUserAgent::Proxy
ConfigItem.Description: Connections for http/ftp via a proxy.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::FileUpload
ConfigItem.Description: Enable file upload in package manager frontend?

ConfigItem.Name: Package::RepositoryRoot
ConfigItem.Description: Location to get online repository list for additional packages. The first available result will be used.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::RepositoryList
ConfigItem.Description: List of online repositories (for example you also can use other installations as repositoriy by using Key="http://example.com/otrs/public.pl?Action=PublicRepository;File=" and Content="Some Name").

ConfigItem.Name: Package::RepositoryAccessRegExp
ConfigItem.Description: IP RegExp for accessing local repository. You need to enable this to have access to your local repository. Package::RepositoryList is required on the remote host.

ConfigItem.Name: Package::Timeout
ConfigItem.Description: Timeout for package downloads (in seconds). Overwrites "WebUserAgent::Timeout".

ConfigItem.Name: Package::Proxy
ConfigItem.Description: Fetch packages via proxy. Overwrites "WebUserAgent::Proxy".

ConfigItem.Name: SOAP::User
ConfigItem.Description: The user name to access the SOAP handle (bin/cgi-bin/rpc.pl).

ConfigItem.Name: SOAP::Password
ConfigItem.Description: The password to access the SOAP handle (bin/cgi-bin/rpc.pl).

ConfigItem.Name: PDF
ConfigItem.Description: Enable PDF output? The CPAN module PDF::API2 is required. If not installed PDF output will be disabled.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::LogoFile
ConfigItem.Description: File for the logo in the page header (gif|jpg|png, 700 x 100 pixel).

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::PageSize
ConfigItem.Description: Standard-size of PDF pages.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::MaxPages
ConfigItem.Description: Maximum number of pages per PDF file.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###Proportional
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalBold
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle bold proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle italic proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###ProportionalBoldItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle bold italic proportional font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###Monospaced
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedBold
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle bold monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle italic monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PDF::TTFontFile###MonospacedBoldItalic
ConfigItem.Description: Path and TTF-File to handle bold italic monospaced font in PDF documents.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP
ConfigItem.Description: Enable PGP support? When PGP support is enabled for signing and securing mail, it is HIGHLY recommended that the web server be run as the OTRS user. Otherwise, there will be problems with the privileges when accessing .gnupg folder.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Bin
ConfigItem.Description: Path to PGP binary.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Options
ConfigItem.Description: Options for PGP binary.

ConfigItem.Name: PGP::Key::Password
ConfigItem.Description: Password for private PGP key.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME
ConfigItem.Description: Enable S/MIME support?

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::Bin
ConfigItem.Description: Path to openssl binary. Maybe openssl need a HOME env ($ENV{HOME} = '/var/lib/wwwrun';).

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::CertPath
ConfigItem.Description: Directory where SSL certificates are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: SMIME::PrivatePath
ConfigItem.Description: Directory where private SSL certificates are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSenderName
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the name that should be used by the application when sending notifications. The sender name is used to build the complete display name for the notification master (i.e. "OTRS Notification Master" otrs@your.example.com). Notifications are messages such as en::Customer::QueueUpdate or en::Agnet::Move.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSenderEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Please enter the e-mail address that should be used by the application when sending notifications. The e-mail address is used to build the complete display name for the notification master (i.e. "OTRS Notification Master" otrs@your.example.com). You can use the OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN variable as set in your configuation, or choose another email address. Notifications are messages such as en::Customer::QueueUpdate or en::Agnet::Move.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSubjectLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Subject for notification mail to agents with token about new requested password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationBodyLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Body for notification mail to agents with token about new requested password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
you or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
If you want to do this, click on this link to get a new password.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>index.pl?Action=LostPassword;Token=<OTRS_TOKEN>
Your OTRS Notification Master

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationSubjectLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Subject for the notification email to agents about new password.

ConfigItem.Name: NotificationBodyLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Body for notification mail to agents about new password.

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
you or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
New Password: <OTRS_NEWPW>
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>index.pl
Your OTRS Notification Master

ConfigItem.Name: System::Permission
ConfigItem.Description: These are the standard permissions available for agents within the application. If more permissions are needed, you can enter them here. Permissions must be hard coded to be effective. Please ensure, when adding any of the afore mentioned permissions, that the "rw" permission remains the last entry.

ConfigItem.Name: System::Customer::Permission
ConfigItem.Description: These are the standard permissions available for customers within the application. If more permissions are needed, you can enter them here. Permissions must be hard coded to be effective. Please ensure, when adding any of the afore mentioned permissions, that the "rw" permission remains the last entry.

ConfigItem.Name: PerformanceLog
ConfigItem.Description: Enable PerformanceLog to log the page response time. Take care, this will take system performance (you also need to enable Frontend::Module###AdminPerformanceLog!).

ConfigItem.Name: PerformanceLog::File
ConfigItem.Description: Logfile of PerformanceLog.

ConfigItem.Name: PerformanceLog::FileMax
ConfigItem.Description: Max. size in MB of log file.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTable
ConfigItem.Description: The name of the table, where the customer preferences are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTableKey
ConfigItem.Description: Key for preferences table.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTableValue
ConfigItem.Description: Name of column in preferences table to store the data.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesTableUserID
ConfigItem.Description: Name of column in preference table, where the UserID is stored.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesView
ConfigItem.Description: Display order of the different items in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Password
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Password object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###SpellDict
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the SpellDict object in the preference view. Take care to maintain the dictionaries installed in the system in the data section.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Comment
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Comment object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###FreeText
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Freetext object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Language
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Language object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###Theme
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Time object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###OutOfOffice
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Out Of Office object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###TimeZone
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the Time-Zone object in the preference view.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSessionName
ConfigItem.Description: Name of the key for customer sessions.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###CSVSeparator
ConfigItem.Description: Gives end users the possibility to override the separator character for CSV files defined in the translation files.

Hash.Item: Select the separator character used in CSV files (stats and searches). If you don't select a separator here, the default separator for your language will be used.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelUserID
ConfigItem.Description: UserID for customer panel.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerGroupSupport
ConfigItem.Description: Activate support for customer groups?

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerGroupAlwaysGroups
ConfigItem.Description: If CustomerGroupSupport is enabled and you don't want to manage every user for these groups, then put the groups for every customer user in there.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::HeaderMetaModule###1-Refresh
ConfigItem.Description: Module to generate html refresh header of html sites.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-ShowAgentOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Module that shows the currently loged in agents in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::NotifyModule###1-ShowCustomerOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Module that shows the currently loged in customers in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelLoginURL
ConfigItem.Description: Alternate login URL for the customer panel..

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelLogoutURL
ConfigItem.Description: Alternate logout URL for the customer panel.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###1-GoogleMaps
ConfigItem.Description: A customer item (icon) which generates an google maps icon at the end of an customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###2-Google
ConfigItem.Description: A customer item (icon) which generates an google icon at the end of an customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###2-LinkedIn
ConfigItem.Description: A customer item (icon) which generates an LinkedIn icon at the end of an customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CustomerUser::Item###3-XING
ConfigItem.Description: A customer item (icon) which generates an XING icon at the end of an customer info block.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelPreApplicationModule###CustomerAccept
ConfigItem.Description: This module and its PreRun() function will be executed, if defined, for every request. This module is useful to check some user options or to display news about new applications.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanel::InfoKey
ConfigItem.Description: Key to check with CustomerAccept. If this user preferences key is true, then the message is accepted by the system.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanel::InfoFile
ConfigItem.Description: Shown InfoFile, that is located under Kernel/Output/HTML/Standard/CustomerAccept.dtl.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Activate lost password feature for customers?

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelCreateAccount
ConfigItem.Description: Can Customers create their own account?

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Subject for notification mail to cutomers with token about new requested password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelBodyLostPasswordToken
ConfigItem.Description: Body for notification mail to customers with token about new requested password (after using this link the new password will be sent).

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
you or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
If you want to do this, click on this link to get a new password.
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl?Action=CustomerLostPassword;Token=<OTRS_TOKEN>
Your OTRS Notification Master

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Subject of notification mail to customers about new password.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelBodyLostPassword
ConfigItem.Description: Body of notification mail for customers about new password.

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
you or someone impersonating you has requested to change your OTRS password.
New Password: <OTRS_NEWPW>
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl
Your OTRS Notification Master

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelSubjectNewAccount
ConfigItem.Description: Subject for notification email to customers about new account.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPanelBodyNewAccount
ConfigItem.Description: Body of notification email to customer about new account.

Setting.TextArea:
Hi <OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME>,
you or someone impersonating you has created a new OTRS account for you (<OTRS_USERFIRSTNAME> <OTRS_USERLASTNAME>).
Login: <OTRS_USERLOGIN> Password: <OTRS_USERPASSWORD>
<OTRS_CONFIG_HttpType>://<OTRS_CONFIG_FQDN>/<OTRS_CONFIG_ScriptAlias>customer.pl
Your OTRS Notification Master

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule
ConfigItem.Description: Module to authenticate customers.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CryptType
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you have to specify the crypt type of passwords.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Table
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you have to specify the name f the table where your customer data are stored.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CustomerKey
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you have to specify the name of the column for the CustomerKey in your customer table.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::CustomerPassword
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you have to specify the column name for the CustomerPassword in your customer table.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::DSN
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you hav to specify the DSN for the connection to the customer table.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::User
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify a username to connect to your customer table.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Password
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify a password to connect to your customer table.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::DB::Type
ConfigItem.Description: If "DB" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify a database driver (normaly autodetection is used).

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::HTTPBasicAuth::Replace
ConfigItem.Description: If "HTTPBasicAuth" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify to strip leading parts of user names (e. g. for domains like example_domain\user to user).

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::HTTPBasicAuth::ReplaceRegExp
ConfigItem.Description: If "HTTPBasicAuth" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify (by using a RegExp) to strip parts of REMOTE_USER (e. g. for to remove tailing domains). RegExp-Note, $1 will be the new Login.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Host
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify your LDAP host.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::BaseDN
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, specify your BaseDN.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UID
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, specify the UID.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::GroupDN
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::Authmodule, you can check if the user is allowed to auth because he is in a posixGroup, e.g. user needs to be in a group xyz to use otrs. Specify the group, who may access the system.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::AccessAttr
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify access attributes here.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UserAttr
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify user attributes. For LDAP posixGroups objectclass UID, for non ldap posixGroups objectclass full user DN.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::SearchUserDN
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and your users have only anonymous access to the LDAP tree, but you want to search through the data, you can do this with a user who has access to the LDAP directory. Specify the username for this special user here.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::SearchUserPw
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and your users have only anonymous access to the LDAP tree, but you want to search through the data, you can do this with a user who has access to the LDAP directory. Specify the password for this special user here.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::AlwaysFilter
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected, you can add a filter to each LDAP query, e.g. (mail=*), (objectclass=user) or (!objectclass=computer).

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::UserSuffix
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule an if you want to add a suffix to every customer login name, specifiy it here, e. g. you just want to write the username user but in your ldap directory exists user@domain.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Params
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule and special paramaters are needed for the Net::LDAP perl module, you can specify them here. See "perldoc Net::LDAP" for more information about the parameters.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::LDAP::Die
ConfigItem.Description: If "LDAP" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify if the applications will stop if e. g. a server can't connected (e. g. network problems).

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Host
ConfigItem.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, specify your radius host.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Password
ConfigItem.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, specfiy the password to authenticate to your radius host.

ConfigItem.Name: Customer::AuthModule::Radius::Die
ConfigItem.Description: If "Radius" was selected for Customer::AuthModule, you can specify if the applications will stop if e. g. a server can't connected (e. g. network problems).

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPreferences
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the customer preference table.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPreferencesView
ConfigItem.Description: Order of the different items in the customer preferences view.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###Password
ConfigItem.Description: All parameters for the password area in the customer preferences.

ConfigItem.Description: All parameters for the PGP area in the customer preferences.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###SMIME
ConfigItem.Description: All parameters for the S/MIME area in the customer preferences.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###Logout
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###CustomerPreferences
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###CustomerCalendarSmall
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###CustomerAccept
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###PictureUpload
ConfigItem.Description: Customer frontend module registration for the PictureUpload object in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###SpellingInline
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Themes
ConfigItem.Description: Specify the available themes on your system. Value 1 means active, 0 means inactive.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::CommonParam###Action
ConfigItem.Description: Default value for the Action parameter. The Frontend-Module which is used as default if no Action parameter given.

ConfigItem.Name: PublicFrontend::CommonParam###Action
ConfigItem.Description: Default value for the Action parameter for the public frontend. The Action parameter is used in the scripts of the system.

ConfigItem.Name: PublicFrontend::Module###PublicDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: PublicFrontend::Module###PublicRepository
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Module###AgentStats
ConfigItem.Description: FrontendModuleRegistration for Stats to define the registration settings in the program and to set rights and positions of icons in the navigation bar.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::StatsHook
ConfigItem.Description: To set the stats hook.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::StatsStartNumber
ConfigItem.Description: Start stats counting from e. g. 10000. Every new stat increments this number.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::SearchPageShown
ConfigItem.Description: Default maximum number of search results shown on the Overview page.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DefaultSelectedDynamicObject
ConfigItem.Description: Default selection at the drop down menu for dynamic objects (Form: Common Specification).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DefaultSelectedPermissions
ConfigItem.Description: Default selection at the drop down menu for permissions (Form: Common Specification).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DefaultSelectedFormat
ConfigItem.Description: Default selection at the drop down menu for stats format (Form: Common Specification). Please insert the format key (see Stats::Format).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::SearchLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Search Limit.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Format
ConfigItem.Description: Possible output formats.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::GraphSize
ConfigItem.Description: Size of stat graph.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::t_margin
ConfigItem.Description: Top margin of chart.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::l_margin
ConfigItem.Description: Left margin of chart.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::b_margin
ConfigItem.Description: Bottom margin of chart.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::r_margin
ConfigItem.Description: Right margin of chart.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::bgclr
ConfigItem.Description: Backgroundcolor of the picture.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::transparent
ConfigItem.Description: Is the picture transparent?

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::fgclr
ConfigItem.Description: Border color of the chart.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::boxclr
ConfigItem.Description: Background color of the chart.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::accentclr
ConfigItem.Description: Bordercolor of the legend.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::legendclr
ConfigItem.Description: Text color of the legend.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::textclr
ConfigItem.Description: Text color of the chart (e. g. caption).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::dclrs
ConfigItem.Description: Colors for the graphs.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::line_width
ConfigItem.Description: Boldness of the line drawed by the graph.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::legend_placement
ConfigItem.Description: Placement of the legend. This should be a two letter key of the form: 'B[LCR]|R[TCB]'. The first letter indicates the placement (Bottom or Right), and the second letter the alignment (Left, Right, Center, Top, or Bottom).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::legend_spacing
ConfigItem.Description: Spacing of the legends.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::legend_marker_width
ConfigItem.Description: Width of the legend.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::Graph::legend_marker_height
ConfigItem.Description: Height of the legend.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::TimeType
ConfigItem.Description: Selection of the time type which should be shown.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::ExchangeAxis
ConfigItem.Description: If you activate this option an agent can exchange the axis of a stat if he generates one.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::UseAgentElementInStats
ConfigItem.Description: If you activate this option you can generate individual-related stats.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::CustomerIDAsMultiSelect
ConfigItem.Description: If you activate this option all CustomerIDs will be shown in a multi-select field (Not useful if you have a lot of CustomerIDs).

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::MaxXaxisAttributes
ConfigItem.Description: Default maximum number of X-axis attributes for the time scale.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::DSN
ConfigItem.Description: If you want to use a mirror database for agent ticket fulltext search or to generate stats, specify the DSN to this database.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::User
ConfigItem.Description: If you want to use a mirror database for agent ticket fulltext search or to generate stats, you can specify the user to authenticate to this database.

ConfigItem.Name: Core::MirrorDB::Password
ConfigItem.Description: If you want to use a mirror database for agent ticket fulltext search or to generate stats, you can specify the password to authenticate to this database.

ConfigItem.Name: LanguageDebug
ConfigItem.Description: Should debugging be turned to debug your translation set? If this is set to "Yes" all strings (text) without translations are written to STDERR. This can be helpful when you are creating an new tranlation file. Otherwise, this option should remain set to "No".

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0000-ProductNotify
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend. "Group" is used to restriced access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" defines the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0400-UserOnline
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend. "Limit" defines the number of entries displayed by default. "Group" is used to restriced access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" defines the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0410-RSS
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend. "Limit" defines the number of entries displayed by default. "Group" is used to restriced access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0200-Image
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend. "Group" is used to restriced access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0210-MOTD
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the Message of the Day (MOTD) in the Agent Dashboard. "Group" is used to restriced access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0300-IFrame
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend. "Group" is used to restriced access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" indicates if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTL" indicates the cache expiration period in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::FilterText###OutputFilterTextAutoLink
ConfigItem.Description: A filter to process the text in the articles in order to highlight predefined keywords.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###CVE
ConfigItem.Description: A filter for html output to add links behind CVE numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Bugtraq
ConfigItem.Description: A filter for html output to add links behind Bugtraq numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###MSBulletins
ConfigItem.Description: A filter for html output to add links behind MSBulletin numbers. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Setting1
ConfigItem.Description: A filter for html output to add links behind a defined string. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::Output::OutputFilterTextAutoLink###Setting2
ConfigItem.Description: A filter for html output to add links behind a defined string. The element Image allows two input kinds. At once the name of an image (e.g. faq.png). In this case the OTRS image path will be used. The second possiblity is to insert the link to the image.

ConfigItem.Name: Secure::DisableBanner
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, the OTRS version tag will be removed from the HTML headers.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Enabled
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, OTRS will deliver all CSS and JavaScript in minified form.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonCSS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of CSS files to always load for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonCSS::IE7###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of IE7-specific CSS files to always load for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonCSS::IE8###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of IE8-specific CSS files to always load for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Agent::CommonJS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of JS files to always load for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::CommonCSS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of CSS files to always load for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::CommonCSS::IE7###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of IE7-specific CSS files to always load for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Loader::Customer::CommonJS###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: List of JS files to always load for the customer interface.
